newsitem.title: MOROCCO: Quarter of million Moroccans head home via Tangier.
newsitem.headline: Quarter of million Moroccans head home via Tangier.

text.p: Over a quarter of a million Moroccan expatriates headed home for holidays through Tangier port in July, a Moroccan official said.

In a statement on the Moroccan news agency MAP on Monday, Fouad Znatti, Tangier envoy of the Hassan II foundation, said 259,375 Moroccans who lived abroad entered the country through the northern port.
About 40,700 other Moroccans transited the port in the same period, he said, adding that nine ships ran a shuttle service between Tangier and the southern Spanish port of Algeciras.

Remittances by Moroccans working abroad make an important contribution to the economy. In 1996 they totalled 17.5 billion dirhams ($1.75 billion at current exchange rates), up 7.5 percent from 16.3 billion dirhams the year before, according to the central bank.
